fr.curie.cd2sbgnml.graphics

Class GeometryUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.curie.cd2sbgnml.graphics.GeometryUtils

  • public class GeometryUtils
extends Object
    Util class containing only static methods, dealing with geometry objects. Methods can be grouped into different themes: - creating and applying transforms to change system of coordinates - converting anchor points to coordinates depending of shapes, and vice versa - basic geometry things like angle unit conversion, slope, intersection of lines... - auxiliary units placement geometry - and more...

        public GeometryUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • getTransformsToGlobalCoords

        public static List<AffineTransform> getTransformsToGlobalCoords(Point2D origin,
                                                                Point2D px)
        Given 2 points in global map coordinate, defining an origin and a unit vector, returns a list of transforms that can be applied to convert local coordinates (in the space defined by those 2 points) to global coordinates (same system the 2 points are provided with). The y is considered to be perpendicular to x, pointing to the right of x (with a global system having a y axis pointing down).
        Returns:
        list of AffineTransform that, if applied in order on a local coordinates, yield the global coordinates.

      • getTransformsToLocalCoords

        public static List<AffineTransform> getTransformsToLocalCoords(Point2D origin,
                                                               Point2D px)
        just reverse the order and invert each transform
        Parameters:
        origin -
        px -
        Returns:

      • getTransformsToGlobalCoords

        public static List<AffineTransform> getTransformsToGlobalCoords(Point2D origin,
                                                                Point2D px,
                                                                Point2D py)
        Given 3 points in global map coordinate, defining an origin and 2 unit vectors, returns a list of transforms that can be applied to convert local coordinates (in the space defined by those 3 points) to global coordinates (same system the 3 points are provided with).
        Returns:
        list of AffineTransform that, if applied in order on a local coordinates, yield the global coordinates.

      • convertPoints

        public static List<Point2D.Float> convertPoints(List<Point2D.Float> points,
                                                List<AffineTransform> transforms)
        Apply a list of affine transforms to a list of points. Used to change the coordinate system of a set of points.
        Parameters:
        points - a list of 2D coordinates
        transforms - a list of transforms to be applied
        Returns:
        a new list of points

        public static Point2D.Float getMiddleOfPolylineSegment(List<Point2D.Float> points,
                                                       int segment)
        Given a polyline defined by a list of points, and a segment index (starting at 0 for the first segment of the polyline), returns the middle of the specified segment. Polyline has to be valid, point list has to have at least 2 points.
        Parameters:
        points -
        segment -
        Returns:

      • rectanglePerimeterPointFromAngle

        public static Point2D.Float rectanglePerimeterPointFromAngle(Rectangle2D.Float rect,
                                                             double deg)
        taken from: https://stackoverflow.com/a/31886696 Angle is signed in degree, ranges from -180 to 180 (can go further but is corrected at the beginning of the function), 0 at east of x axis, Coordinate system has Y axis pointing down. Result is given as relative coordinates starting on top left corner of the rectangle. !! The result does not correspond to how celldesigner places things around a shape. !!
        Parameters:
        rect -
        deg -
        Returns:

      • getPositionFromAngle

        public static Point2D.Float getPositionFromAngle(Rectangle2D.Float rect,
                                                 float deg)
        result returned in relative coordinates from rectangle center
        Parameters:
        rect -
        deg - signed angle [-180, 180]
        Returns:

      • getTopPositionFromRatio

        public static Point2D.Float getTopPositionFromRatio(Rectangle2D.Float rect,
                                                    float ratio)
        For genes modification residues, CD uses a % of the glyph width as location. They are always placed on top.
        Parameters:
        rect -
        ratio - between 0 and 1, from the left side
        Returns:
        point in relative coordinate from rect center
